comment: Hands down one of the WORST professors I have seen in Kennesaw. She is tolerable, but completely lost my respect when she started yelling at students on the first day of lab. Straight up rude and unprofessional at times. She does NOT accept late work and will get aggressive if too many questions are asked. Do NOT waste your tuition on her!

As long as you what you're told you'll be fine. She follows the book exactly, so it isn't that difficult. However, she is very condescending. Her class wasn't one I looked forward to but if you treat her with respect she'll respect you.

I mainly just agree with what everyone else has said. Multiple times I asked clarifying questions about the lab, followed what she told me, and then was told at the end of lab that I did it wrong and had to redo some data. The tables around me talked a lot and found she wasn't very consistent in telling everyone the same information in general.

You will get chastised in front of the class at some point. An A1 meat rider. Have literally barely said two words to this woman, and she acts like I'm so terrible and embarrasses me so much in that class for no reason. Also spaces out a lot when you're trying to talk to her and ask questions. just strange, rude women; find someone else, please.

heavy accent, it was kind of hard to understand her. takes forever to reply to emails. Grades so ridiculously tough for no reason, and barely explains why you got it wrong. Very standoffish. Loves getting in up in your personal space.

I agree with everyone. She is pretty rude and condescending. When you ask questions, its almost like she's saying "duh" when you ask a question HOWEVER she accepts late work and the submissions are in person (which I perfer). I'd rather has a rude teacher that accepts late work than a nice one that doesn't.

Dr. Baruah was helpful at times. She lectures before every lab to help explain what we are doing, but her accent makes it difficult to understand her at times. The lab is demanding, but if you do what you're supposed to and put the effort in, you can very easily pass her class. The only issue is when she grades, she doesn't explain what's wrong.

I only asked her a few questions the entire semester and every time she was very rude and condescending. She would make students feel stupid, ask them if they understood English, (despite her being the one with a heavy accent), tell us to hurry, and overall was just rude. Her lab assistant answered all our questions while she'd sit back and watch.
Dear Mrs Baruah I loved your class so much that I have some news for you Ernan got a 68 on his chemistry test

Wonderful professor. Explains all the experiments very thoroughly beforehand, and is very helpful throughout. Really ensures that everyone understands what is going on. Her explanations in this lab even helped me better understand the lecture. She expects students to put effort into the class though, so if you don't try, the grade will reflect it.

idk why her rating is so low. She spends about 45 minutes lecturing before lab to make sure we understand, accent is sometimes hard to understand. She always lets us out early. It is a lot of work but that's expected with lab. My only criticism is that if you get something wrong on a assignment, she marks off but does not explain why it's wrong.

She's pretty rude most of the time. Has a thick accent that makes communication difficult. Pretty much not available for communication outside of the lab period. She's alright, but I'd take someone else if I could.

I had a good experience with this professor overall. The labs were very time consuming but were relatively straight forward. Professor Baruah is a fair grader, goes over the labs beforehand, and will answer any questions.

Overall, I had a positive experience in this. I found her to be likable and approachable. However, at times her accent made it a bit difficult to fully understand her instructions, but once I got past that hurdle, the lab work was not particularly challenging, just a good amount of it.

This class was very time consuming, but that is expected with any chem lab. There are weekly lab quizzes and labs. Professor Baruah is a fair grader and very understanding. She is also good about answering questions and responding to emails quick. If you do the work it's almost impossible to not do well.

This professor was a bit unclear when she explained things but I always felt fine asking her questions. Her accent is a bit thick and hard to understand but if you can get past that I think she was pretty good. This lab is a lot of work but i think that just comes with it being a chem lab. Having an SI definitely helped though

Read the over the lab procedures before class. The labs are easy to follow for the most part. Pre-lab quizzes may ask questions that you won't find in the lab manual or lecture so you'll have to look them up. She drops the lowest lab and pre lab quiz. Plan to rely on the internet more than lecture as lab flow and lecture will be different.

This professor was probably the worst I've ever had. She was mostly nice but a couple of times she was very rude to me and my friend in the class. She explains how to do the lab for an hour at the beginning of class and you can not understand her at all. To top it all off she never reads or responds to her emails! Please do not take her!!

Super nice professor, but she does have a thick accent that is difficult to understand. She is willing to help with any questions one may have. She goes over that the lab is beforehand and teaches things we may not comprehend yet. However, it took so long for her to grade labs and did not offer any study help for the final.

The lab wasn't very hard. The major issue I found was she was very rude condescending to you if you had any questions. She wasn't happy that no one in the class wanted to ask her questions, but when we did she acted like we were dumb.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Labs are pretty easy and very straight forward, the only issues I had was the work outside of class (prelab and postlab assignments) can be time consuming. She does have a pretty thick accent so it's important to pay attention when she's talking, before lab she goes over all the procedure and is super helpful! I'd recommend if you want to learn
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor was the absolute worst ive ever had. She is incredibly hard to understand and quite frankly didn't care wether you learned the material or not. Gave tons of HW with zero feedback, tests were outrageously hard. Avoid at all cost.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Yes she can be kind of tough. But she will help you with a lot and basically but the problems on the board so you just fill them out with your numbers. She does have a really thick accent that can be hard to understand. But she did help me a lot. Only thing is I did have a B in the class and ended with a C because of the final. Overall, okay.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: this class is hard! she moves at a very fast pace, very rude if youre unsure or confused on something and shes also very hard to get in touch with outside of class. i emailed her THREE TIMES!!! and i didnt get an email back til two weeks later, if youre reading this and looking for a chemistry lab professor DO NOT TAKE HER!! ight im done lol.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took her as a simple lab due to the fact that it would be necessary for me to understand chemistry better. She has a thick accent which is difficult to understand and is not helpful when explaining materials. She may ridicule you for not understanding the material. She rushes students when doing lab work. Do not take her lab if youre a freshman.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Explains labs beforehand and works to answer questions. Labflow was confusing but she is responsive to any emailed questions. She drops the lowest grades in almost every category. If you pay attention, complete your lab notebook, and stay up to date on lab flow the class isn't so bad. For college-level, she is a pretty fair teacher.

By far the worst class I've taken at this school. I dont think it would be as bad if I took this class during non-covid times but her online teaching is the worst. Her video lectures are useless for learning the course material. All basically just reads the slides and it is very hard to understand her. The hw website gives zero feedback. Avoid her.
Terrible communication in and outside of class. Responded to about 50% of emails i sent her. Ridiculous amounts of homework, and quizzes included things we had not yet learned.

I had to drop this course because she was not very helpful and her accent was very deep so she is kind of hard to understand. If taking her for lab, please go with a different professor or youre gonna be just as confused as me and purchase a lab kit and be sitting on the video call confused. Look for a different professor!
rating_tags: Caring--Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I just finished taking the class completely remote because of Covid, but I was caused so much stress because of lack of communication. She was never clear + Id sent her 4 emails before going though the lab coordinator to get a response. I got this grade without going to lab and basically did everything myself. Dont take her if you cant self-teach

I took her lab during corona so my ideas may be skewed but before remote learning I had a high A and then I finished the class with a B because the communication in this class was awful. It is not even a hard class, just nothing is explained and she and the TA does not respond to emails. I hated this class, it stressed me out. Would not recommend.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! I took OChem for the first time with Dr. Haseltine and did not do well. Professor Baruah makes the topics very easy to understand. She gives three "pop quizzes" in class. They consist of three questions and are only for extra credit to add points to the exam grades. 3 Exams (easy), 1 Final, and Quizzes. Drops 1 Exam.

Prof. Baruah is clear with her due dates and is easily accessible outside class. However, she teaches straight from blurry powerpoints and doesn't understand how D2L works. She cannot answer simple yes/no questions due to the language barrier. She simply interrupts and rants about nothing for 5 minutes. Learn from textbook if you must take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: As someone who got a 100 in this class, it was a complete mess. I could have taught this class better. Professor had limited knowledge on the subject and what was actually important. If she ever teaches this class again, treat the textbook as the holy grail and learn everything. Do better than everyone else and benefit from test curves.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I would not recommend this professor for chem 2! During lecture she flew through PowerPoints and it was very hard to understand. Sometimes she seemed confused herself about what she was teaching. The exams were a joke. They didnt represent what was taught in class. Most of the lessons were self taught. I rather get ran over then take her again!

The language barrier is hard to get past but the way she runs the class is the biggest issue. You will not get a grade you desire without basically teaching yourself. The powerpoints on D2L alone won't be enough to get you a B let alone an A. She does drop your lowest quiz and exam grade at the end of the semester however.

She hardly ever helped in lab. Her assistants did all of the work, and they were not very helpful either sometimes. The pre-lab write ups are specific, and you can't enter the lab without it. The tests are very difficult. I had an B+ in the class, and the final dropped me to a C. Only good thing was the lowest grades in each section were dropped.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: To be short, she is a TERRIBLE professor and sees no wrong in anything that she does. There are 3 exams ( lowest one drop), online quizzes, and the final (ACS). If you HAVE to take her, purchase the textbook, teach yourself and study EXACTLY what is on her study guides and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Where do I start? I had this professor for 1151L and now for 1152. She was ok for lab, everything was structured, and clear. The 1152 lecture was a hot mess. Seems like she never taught lecture. Her lecture tests were 25Q for 3-4 chapters, full of mistakes and unclear Q. Final was a standardized test, which she did not prepare us for. RUN. FAR.

Im still currently in this class so Im not sure what my grade will be but dont take her. You cant understand what she says bc of her accent, she rambles, puts entire paragraphs from the next book on her PowerPoint, has a lot of errors on her tests that she ends up correcting (sometimes never corrects) during the test... overall really awful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This class single handedly brought down my gpa because not because I had to teach myself everything but because after I read the text and came to class hoping for clarification, she just confused me and my peers even more. I once stayed after class 20 minutes hoping for help on a problem she put on the board and she told me she wouldn't help me.

She cant do the simplest thing as answer a students question. We will ask her a question and she wont let us get the whole question out and goes on a five-minute rant about stuff that doesnt answer the simple yes or no question. You can barely understand when she lectures because she talks so fast and the language barrier is a serious concern.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Awesome lab teacher! Really breaks down the lab to the T, makes it effortless for you. Final was difficulty but if you pass the class in every other area the final wont weigh as heavily !! Make sure to keep up with the online assessments, surplus time for everything !! Has a heavy accent but you get use to it !
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hard to understand, but just sit upfront because she is quiet as well. I sat in the back corner, which was manageable but hard to hear. Really nice. Seems strict at first but loves conversation. She drops your lowest lab OR content assessment, I do not remember... but overall, I would say take her.

Great lady but her accent can be very thick so she's hard to understand at times. Spends about 45 minutes discussing the lab before letting you go do your thing. Will walk around and help if you ask questions. Grades pretty fairly. Make sure you have your lab book done before attending as well as wearing correct lab attire. She will turn you away.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is helpful but her accent makes it hard to understand her. She spends the first 45 minutes of lab talking about it in detail and explaining what calculations needed to be done. She grades fairly and if you follow the instructions you should get an A. The final is detailed and make sure you study labs.

She has a thick accent, but you can understand her. She explains everything about the lab within the 1st hour. That might be annoying for those who want to start immediately, but it's extremely helpful if you didn't fully understand the manual.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor subalita is nice and throughly explains all of the labs, but she can be a bit hard to understand and while attendance is mandatory you kinda have to go because of all the labs due. Definitely have to work for an A but it isnt too difficult with a little effort
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: I was worried about her rating on RMP when I signed up to take her, but after taking her, I feel relieved. Shes very sweet. Her accent is easy to get used to. If you have any questions during lab, she will answer them.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great Professor! She explains the lab very well and she is very willing to help. She can be a little slow but it's usually in before the next class meeting. Her accent is strong but you get used to it. She's a easy grader as well. Just go to every lab, ask questions if you need to and you'll most likely get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: She is very sweet and really wants you to do well in the lab. If you're nice to her and smile she will like you! I have had a great experience in her class because of this. In my class we had a few online tests because lab only met every other week. You had 3 hours to take them and could google a lot of it. She has a strong accent
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She's really nice and lenient when it comes to lab attire. At first her accent was hard to understand but you get used to it. She may seem hard at the beginning of class but it becomes easier. She likes letting us out of lab early too- about 2 or 3 of them. She's cool, take her.

Professor Buruah went over almost every lab before the lab began. Just pay attention to her review before and you will be fine during the lab, but I recommend sitting up front because it is a bit hard to understand her thick accent. The prefabs are easy and she drops a lot of grades. Beware of content assessments, some content wasn't covered in lab

She will help you if you are confused about anything. My partner and I got different grades on the lab reports most of the time even though we had the same answers. Her accent is a little hard to understand, but she explains how to do the labs very well.  She took a while to put in my content assessment grades. Overall she is a pretty good teacher.

This professor is hard to understand, however it is not detrimental to affecting your grade. If you show up and do good on the labs and assignments then you should do good in the class. There was a TA that was also helpful. There is a lab every other week. On the day you don't have lab, you take an online test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: VERY hard to understand. She was not a bad professor, so i would retake. However, you have to check your grade with your lab partner because she has messed up every grade ive gotten in this lab by not giving me points where needed. She has no problem changing the grade if you show her the issue. Again, VERY VERY hard to understand. Heavy accent

Mrs. Baruah is very nice. Although she is VERY difficult to understand, if you talk to her she will help you. Grades pretty tough, but if you talk to her she'll change your grade if you convince her to. This class is hard, but it is possible to get a decent grade.
I would NOT recommend her for lab. Very hard to understand. took point of from my grade because i wore shorts for Final Exam. If you have choice, take someone else.

Part time instructor; has moderately heavy Indian accent; some language barriers but not detrimental to learning or lab work as long as you focus on what she says. If you have the option of S. Baruah or another instructor/ professor, most likely choose the other option
